form.name: form1

p.span: Per the Governors orders issued yesterday, March 31, 2020, Bovina ISD will remain closed until Monday, May 4, 2020 in order to support our nation’s need to slow the spread of COVID-19. Before that date, decisions will be made on whether to suspend operations further or to re-open campuses. In the meantime, online learning and packet distribution will continue and teachers will be in contact with students to monitor progress.

div.h2: Home of the Mustangs and Fillies

div.div:
500 Halsell Street PO Box 70 | Bovina Texas 79009
Phone: 806-251-1336 | Fax: 806-251-1578

p.span: Per the Governors orders issued today, April 17, 2020, Bovina ISD will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, including summer school, in order to support our nation’s need to slow the spread of COVID-19. Online learning and packet distribution will continue and teachers will continue to be in contact with students to monitor progress. We will continue this method of instruction during summer school for those students that need extra support or for finishing credits.

span.p: In anticipation of inclement weather in the present forecast for Monday evening, April 13, 2020, two meals will be delivered on Monday, April 13, 2020 and no meal service will be provided on Tuesday, April 14, 2020. This will help in keeping our meal service and route delivery staff safe.
Thank you for your understanding and cooperation as we are constantly adjusting to make this work the best for all concerned.

p.span: Bovina Students and Community:

Per the Governors orders issued yesterday, March 31, 2020, Bovina ISD will remain closed until Monday, May 4, 2020 in order to support our nation’s need to slow the spread of COVID-19. Before that date, decisions will be made on whether to suspend operations further or to re-open campuses. In the meantime, online learning and packet distribution will continue and teachers will be in contact with students to monitor progress.

b.span: There will be no food service distribution or delivery on Good Friday, April 10, 2020

p.span: so that our staff may spend well deserved time with their families. Service will resume on Monday, April 13, 2020.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has outlined the need for all communities to implement a social distancing protocol. We want to reiterate a request to our broader community to take the following reasonable precautions to prevent the spread of the illness:
Don’t shake hands
Wash your hands regularly
Limit movement within the community, especially avoiding crowded placed and maintaining 3 to 6 ft of distance between people (at least an arm’s length)
If you are moving around in the community, don’t congregate in large groups

For those who have traveled to areas with known COVID-19 cases – both inside and outside of the country – we ask that you self-quarantine and monitor for symptoms. Students who have traveled should plan to stay home for two weeks after arriving home. Please contact your campus to let them know, and this will be considered an excused absence.
If you suspect you have symptoms

u.span: of COVID-19, call your health care provider for medical advice .

p.span: Keep your child at home if he/she feels ill, even if you think it is just a cold.
Do not leave the house if you are ill, except to access medical care
This is a quickly changing situation, and we will continue to monitor information, will assess conditions, and be in contact with local partners to keep you informed.
Thank you for your support and cooperation as we strive to ensure that all members of the community in Bovina stay safe and healthy.
Denise Anderson
Bovina ISD Superintendent
Bovina ISD Food Service during Closure
Bovina ISD understands the importance of nutritional support for our students during the school closure from March 23 – April 3.
Beginning Tuesday, March 24, 2020, we will be providing grab and go meals for ALL children who are between the ages of 1-18 in Bovina.
Bovina ISD Community:
Beginning this
, our grab and go meal hours will be changed to
. The route delivery service will also run 30 minutes later than it did today. This change is necessary to ensure that our students are receiving their hot meals in a timely manner.
Thank you for your understanding and cooperation as we are constantly adjusting to make this work the best for all concerned.

Also, WT Services has made a “hot spot” available at the First Baptist Church parking lot and that service should be ready to go on Friday. We thank them for helping us and our students stay connected!
Please encourage your child as they are learning new styles of learning, as we are. I will communicate any changes to the school operations schedule as I learn them.
Stay safe and healthy and hope to see all of our students soon!
Denise Anderson, Bovina ISD Superintendent

div.h2: TEA is closely monitoring Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Welcome to Bovina ISD Home of the Mustangs and Fillies

span.div: Welcome to Bovina ISD, where the education of every student is our main objective.
Bovina is a small rural community located in the southwestern Texas Panhandle, with a population of approximately 2000 citizens.

Bovina ISD strives to offer a large school education, in a small school setting. The entire teaching staff at Bovina ISD are Highly Qualified, ensuring that the education our students receive will prepare them for college, or to enter the workplace and be productive citizens.

With all that said, if you are looking for a community with a Home Town atmosphere, where your child can receive an education that will prepare them for whatever they decide to do, whether college, or the workforce, then come by and visit us at Bovina ISD, or contact us at 806-251-1336.

span.title: Article Title: SIGN up for ALERTS

span.div: Please sign up for News, Alerts and Updates, by signing up for this you will recieve news articles,

to keep you informed of current events.Please click here "SIGN UP FOR ALERTS"
